subsection_content: Urethritis is an acute or chronic inflammation of the urethra. Urethral discharge and pain during urination are typical signs of this disease. Urethritis is often caused by bacteria and can be cured with antibiotics (1). The urethra is the tube that carries urine from the bladder out of the body. In addition, the urethra is also the exit route for semen during ejaculation.
subsection_title: viem nieu dao.json. What is urethritis?
subsection_data:
viem nieu dao.json. What is urethritis?
Urethritis is an acute or chronic inflammation of the urethra. Urethral discharge and pain during urination are typical signs of this disease. Urethritis is often caused by bacteria and can be cured with antibiotics (1). The urethra is the tube that carries urine from the bladder out of the body. In addition, the urethra is also the exit route for semen during ejaculation.
